title: A Narrow High Court Win For Prayer Before Government Meetings
teaser: The Supreme Court ruled 5 to 4 that the government can use Christian prayers to start town meetings, so long as legislators don't discriminate against non-Christians. It's a new chapter in the long-running fight over prayer in public places and on public occasions.  NPR's Carrie Johnson explains what happened in the town of Greece, New York.
